name: UICollisionBehaviorDelegate
desc: To respond to UIKit dynamic item collisions, configure a custom class to adopt the UICollisionBehaviorDelegate protocol. Then, in a collision behavior (an instance of the UICollisionBehavior class), set the delegate to be an instance of your custom class.

items.name: func collisionBehavior(UICollisionBehavior, beganContactFor: UIDynamicItem, withBoundaryIdentifier: NSCopying?, at: CGPoint)
items.desc: Called when a collision, between a dynamic item and a collision boundary, has begun.

items.name: func collisionBehavior(UICollisionBehavior, beganContactFor: UIDynamicItem, with: UIDynamicItem, at: CGPoint)
items.desc: Called when a collision between two dynamic items has begun.

items.name: func collisionBehavior(UICollisionBehavior, endedContactFor: UIDynamicItem, withBoundaryIdentifier: NSCopying?)
items.desc: Called when a collision between a dynamic item and a boundary has ended.

items.name: func collisionBehavior(UICollisionBehavior, endedContactFor: UIDynamicItem, with: UIDynamicItem)
items.desc: Called when a collision between two dynamic items has ended.
